theme.paragraph1: Our wedding theme is glamour deluxe – think Dynasty drama, glitter, diamonds, pearls, and fur. We love over the top but above all, we want everyone to feel fantastic!
theme.paragraph2: There's no requirement to dress extravagantly, but it's more than welcome if you want to go all in. Dress up as much – or as moderately – as you like.
theme.paragraph3: Since we are two men and there is no traditional bride, we'd like to emphasize that women are of course welcome to wear white. Do you have an old wedding dress longing to see the dance floor again? Bring it out – it's just fun!
theme.paragraph4: So bring out the sequins, the diamonds, the tuxedo, the pearls, or your most glamorous creation – we can't wait to see how you interpret our Dynasty world!
theme.paragraph5: The wedding's color theme is dark teal and burnt orange. To let our bridesmaids and best men shine in their outfits, we kindly ask guests to avoid these two colors.

q1.question: Are children welcome?
answer: Children are warmly welcome during the mingling between 2:00–4:00 PM.
After that, the evening will be completely child-free so all adults can enjoy the party in peace.

q2.question: Can I bring a +1?
answer: The invitation is digital and personal.
Some are invited as couples and others as singles, so we kindly ask you to come according to the invitation you received.
Thank you for your understanding!

q3.question: What kind of wedding gifts?
answer: If you wish to give a gift, we would most appreciate a contribution to our honeymoon fund to Italy via Swish.
Since we're traveling from Gothenburg, we kindly ask that you don't bring flowers or larger gifts – they're difficult to transport home.

q4.question: Can you bring your own drinks?
answer: No, due to the venue's alcohol license, no outside drinks are allowed
Welcome drinks and 2 drink vouchers will be distributed to everyone
A cash bar will be available throughout the party

q5.question: Where is the venue?
answer: The wedding is held at: Lunedets Camping
Lunedet, 691 91 Karlskoga

q6.question: Is there parking?
answer: Yes, there is plenty of free parking at the area.

q7.question: Is there accommodation nearby?
answer: Yes! There are camping cabins right next to the venue, reserved for guests traveling from afar.
A bed costs 250 SEK per person per night
You can bring your own sheets and towel, or rent them for 250 SEK per person (one-time fee)
There are also camping spots for those who want to bring a caravan or motorhome

q8.question: What food will be served?
answer: Appetizers will be served at the mingling
A delicious grill buffet for dinner, followed by cake and donuts.
Later in the evening, a food truck will serve late-night food.

q9.question: Is there special diet food?
answer: Of course! Please indicate any dietary preferences and allergies when you RSVP, and we'll make sure you get something delicious that suits you.

q10.question: Can I take pictures during the ceremony?
answer: We kindly ask you to let your phones rest during the ceremony

We have a fantastic photographer on site who captures all the moments, and we'd prefer not to have phones sticking up in the pictures. After the ceremony, you're of course welcome to photograph and film as much as you like!

q11.question: Can I share pictures on social media?
answer: Yes, absolutely! There will be QR codes on the tables and signs where you can easily upload your own pictures to our shared wedding album.

q12.question: Can I change my answer later?
answer: Yes, until June 1st. Contact us via email if you need to change anything – after that we need to lock everything for our suppliers.

q13.question: What do I do if I can't come?
answer: Just respond that you can't come when you RSVP. If something comes up at the last minute – please send us a text or email so we know.

q14.question: Is everything indoors or outdoors?
answer: A bit of both! The reception is held outdoors (weather permitting), dinner in the barn, and the party in the stable.
Keep in mind that the wedding takes place in September, dress for the weather!

q15.question: Is there a coat check?
answer: There is a small cloakroom where you can hang your outerwear.
Keep in mind that space is limited, so we recommend leaving your jacket in the car if possible or arriving early to secure a spot.

q16.question: Is there brunch the day after?
answer: Yes!
For those who have registered, a cozy brunch is served between 10:00 AM–12:00 PM for 159 SEK per person.
A perfect way to wrap up the weekend together.
